Description: Add the ending –ksi into the name of the language

Finn: Huoneessa ei ole televisiota eikä sohvaa.
Angol: There is neither a television nor a sofa in the room.

Description: (mukava huone = a nice room; mukava sänky = a comfortable bed)

Finn: Kellarissa on pesula. Siellä on myös sauna.
Angol: The laundry is in the cellar. The sauna is also there.

Finn: Missä?  + ei ole + Mitä? (in a partitive form)

Description: Used when we are talking about the place we are at the moment.

Finn: Kellarissa on pesula.  Siellä on pesukone.
Angol: In the cellar there is the laundry. There is the washing machine
Description: Used when we are referring to a place where we are not at the moment.
Used when we can point out the place and everyone can see it.

Angol: I am sorry, I did not hear.

Description: The translative case (abbreviated TRANSL) is a grammatical case that indicates a change in state of a noun, with the general sense of "becoming X" or "change to X".
